instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1465: What is A1465? A1465 is a model number for a 11 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2924, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00164, 820-3208, 820-3435..
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: Macbook pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1465</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> screen blinking
threads.message: Macbook pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1465</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> screen blinking often. Already tried another screen and it is not screen problem. I think it is no backlight problem is sometimes image move. Any idea?

threads.title: Macbook pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1465</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> screen blinking
Macbook pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1465</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> screen blinking
threads.message: Is ball A5 of <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> for feedback corroding? Is the DC in flex corroded which brings <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> down?

threads.title: Macbook pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1465</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> screen blinking
Macbook pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1465</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> screen blinking
threads.message: This is a CPU issue, I have seen a few with this issue. RIP.

threads.title: Macbook pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1465</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> screen blinking
threads.message: Do you know how to get the PCH part number here? As I could checked some of them are repaired replacing the PCH.

threads.title: Macbook pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1465</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> screen blinking
threads.message: There is no PCH, it is all in the CPU. As I said RIP!

Macbook pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1465</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> screen blinking
threads.message: Bad CPU, just let this thing RIP or if you want to waste time and money try and replace the CPU/RAM.
